ygData.subject: Re: Hope this isn't too OT..but
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm. thats odd. I have my clip plane all the way out and have never seen any texture problems, or crashing problems. (was in commons with 250 other ppl druing
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm. thats odd. I have my clip plane all the way out and have never seen any
texture problems, or crashing problems. (was in commons with 250 other ppl
druing a auction) So im not sure what is up with that. your not by chance
useing a athalon processer are you?

James

----- Original Message -----
From: Mark Muller <markm@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 9:52 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Hope this isn't too OT..but


> From: "Mark Muller" <markm@...>
>
> > From: Trizzen Do'Trevan <trizzen@...>
> >
> > really? From the previous threads, I was going to go
> > online and buy one since I still use a banshee
> > card....now this is making me do a double take.
> >
> > Anymore input? Please?!?!
>
> I have both a Voodoo3 3500 and a Geforce DDR, I prefer the Voodoo. The
> geforce won't do mipmapping, so if you extend your clipplane at all you
get
> some pretty disgusting texture swimming problems, that and the fact that I
> started crashing anytime there were more than 30 people present (fire
> giants, planes...basically places you definitely don't want to crash)
caused
> me to switch back to my Voodoo for EQ. Other than those 2 problems, the
> Geforce was *definitely* faster.
>
